items.str: During an easy run, you should feel relaxed. You should be breathing comfortably
and capable of holding a conversation throughout the run. If you’re a new runner
nothing may feel easy at first – slow down, walk if necessary and control your effort.
These are the bread and butter of your training, the ‘miles in the bank’. Steady runs
build the base that is the foundation for the rest of your training. Conversations are
still possible at this pace but only in shorter sentences.
Running at tempo pace is great for improving your running economy. It’s a
This 16-week training plan is aimed at novice marathon runners covering the distance for
sustained cruise pace that requires concentration. You will find these runs slightly
the first time, with a few tweaks and challenges if you want to test yourself, or if you feel like
uncomfortable as you try to run faster, but they are worth it.
pushing on a bit if your training is going really well.
The plan assumes that you will run three times a week and that you’ve done very little
These are a real focus of the plan. They should be used to develop strength and
running in the past but are generally in good health and committed to your marathon
endurance but also to practise your target marathon pace and control. Long runs
are shown in both time and distance.
The days of the week shown are not fixed. If you change them, try to ensure that a run
day is followed by a rest day (for example, run on Monday, Wednesday and Saturday or
How to hit your fundraising target
If you’re fundraising as part of your TCS London Marathon challenge, we’ve
included tips throughout this plan to help you hit your target.
Now’s the perfect time to get your
We’ve added tips on how to boost your motivation, nail your
cause, add a profile picture and the story of why you’re fundraising for your charity,
nutrition, fundraise like a pro and celebrate successes big and
small! The plan also features easy recipes and podcast ideas to
help you make the most of your rest days. Enjoy!

details of who you’re running for – on flyers and business cards. Hand them out
wherever you go to inspire some random acts of kindness. You could even put it on
a badge on your running kit!

Considering your nutrition strategy is a key component of completing a marathon.
colleagues are sure to step up and support you as you take on this amazing goal.
As your training runs become longer, you’ll start to rely more on carbohydrate to
Research shows a whopping 86% of people almost always donate when they get a
fuel your run. Since our bodies can only store a finite amount of carbohydrate, it’s
request to support a charity event, so don’t be worried about asking!
really important we consume it during the event to keep our energy stores topped
up and prevent us from ‘hitting the wall’.
Once you’ve set up an official fundraising page, your supporters will also be able to
donate to you via the Official App, powered by TCS, on Marathon Day.
Lucozade Sport is the perfect marathon partner to support you throughout your
training for the TCS London Marathon and the event itself. It provides carbohydrates
and electrolytes to enhance your hydration and help maintain your performance
during prolonged endurance exercise – exactly what you need to run a marathon.
Consider training with a bottle belt
If you’d like to follow a training plan that’s more personalised to you, check out our
Official Training Partner - Coopah, the Run Coaching App.
